Class TaskService

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt1002.service.TaskService
public class TaskService
extends java.lang.Object
a class which provides some necessary features which utilises task-data

      Parameters:
      task - Task object to change
      value - boolean new value for task.isRepeatable

    • setFinished

      public static void setFinished​(Task task, boolean value)
      Usedto set the isFinished value and the finishDate of the given task. Will set finish date to 0 if given value is false.
      Parameters:
      task - Task object to change
      value - boolean new value for task.isFinished

      Returns:

    • getTasksSortedByDate

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Task> getTasksSortedByDate​(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
      A method which sorts tasks by their deadline. The task with the earliest deadline will be the first index in the ArrayList. The further away the deadline of the task is, the higher index it has.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of all tasks in the currently selected category, sorted by date.

      Returns:
      an ArrayList of tasks that is sorted alphabetically by the title of the task. it only sorts the

    • getTasksBetweenDates

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Task> getTasksBetweenDates​(long start, long end)
      Finds all tasks withing a given interval. It uses all the tasks that the user has currently active.
      Parameters:
      start - interval start time in ms
      end - interval end time in ms
      Returns:
      Lists of all tasks within the given interval

    • getTasksInDateInterval

      Parameters:
      tasks - The set of tasks the methode is being preformed on.
      start - interval start time in ms.
      end - interval end time in ms.
      Returns:
      Lists of all tasks within the given interval.

      tasks - The set of tasks the methode is being preformed on.
      dateLong - The date.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of all the tasks that occurs that date.

    • containsDesiredNameInTitle

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Task> containsDesiredNameInTitle​(java.lang.String DesiredName)
      Returns an ArrayList of Tasks that have a name or tag that contains the given string. The methode is not case sensitive.
      Parameters:
      DesiredName - A part(or entire) string that is contained in the task(s) that you want to find.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of all the tasks that contains the DesiredName in the title or tag.

      Returns:
      the task-object.

      Parameters:

    • validateTaskInput

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> validateTaskInput​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String description, java.lang.String priority, long deadlineTime, long repeatTime)
      Method that validates if task input is correct.
      Parameters:
      title - Title of task.
      description - Description of the task.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of errorCodes. ErrorCodes can be used i front end to display an errormessage for each scenario.

    • getErrorMessageString

      public static java.lang.String getErrorMessageString​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> errorCodes)
      Methode for returning the right error message as a String depending on the error code.
      Parameters:
      errorCodes - An ArrayList of integers, that contains the potential errorCodes.
      Returns:
      A String containing a description of the errors.

    • getRepeatTasks

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Task> getRepeatTasks​(java.util.ArrayList<Task> ArrayListOfTasks, long end)
      Methode that is used in the dateMethods to simulate all the tasks that would be there if a tasks is repeatable.
      Parameters:
      ArrayListOfTasks - The tasks that are going to be repeated(if they are repeatable).
      end - The limit date of where the repeatable tasks are stopped being cloned.
      Returns:
      A ArrayList of all the cloned Repeatable tasks, with new deadlines.

    • nextRepeatableTask

      public static void nextRepeatableTask​(long taskId)
      Methode that generates the next occurrence of a repeatable task. This is used when a repeatable task is deleted. This is so that completing or deleting a repeating task, wont delete the chain of repeatable tasks. the task is saved directly into the save files.
      Parameters:
      taskId - to find a specific task in the database.

    • convertTimeRepeatToLong

      public static long convertTimeRepeatToLong​(java.lang.String TimeRepeatString)
      takes a description of a repeatable task, and turns it into Millis based on what the string is.
      Parameters:
      TimeRepeatString - The description of the repetition. (Repeat Daily/Repeat Weekly).
      Returns:
      A long representing a week or a day. or 0L if the input is not valid.

    • convertTimeRepeatToString

      public static java.lang.String convertTimeRepeatToString​(Task T)
      Converts a repetition time of a task, into a String which description the timeframe of repetition.
      Parameters:
      T - the Task which repetition time you want to convert
      Returns:
      a String reflecting the repetition time, or None if the time is invalid.

      priority - integer stored in user.
      Returns:

      Parameters:
      Priority - Description of the priority (Low,Medium,High, or default)
      Returns:
      a corresponding int.
